ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Game Theory concepts, Mechanism Design, Auctions
Learned fundamental tools to study microeconomics
I learned a lot about various techniques for solving games, as well as the basics of mechanism design

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Johannes is hands--down the best instructor I have had so far. Even though the material he presented was mostly standard, he managed to provoke interest and point out issues he lacked the time to discuss. While I think it was apparent that the instructor does not genuinely enjoy teaching first--year courses, his class was the best I have taken this semester --- by far. He was available for questions that went beyond the material he covered in class.

The course should recruit better TAs. Weicheng doesn't seem to understand the material very well. Anna only writes dry equations in her session. She is boring and necessarily harsh, therefore unsurprisingly considered to be the worst TA in the first-year courses by most of the class.
Good class, but early in the morning
A lot of materials have been covered, which is good. Yet, motivations for each topic are needed.
I would love to see the course materials written up and posted online to help with revision. The lectures are great but it is hard to keep up with all the details without slides or notes.
I believe it could be improved if lecture notes were provided and if it was taught at a slower pace with a more detailed exposition.
I found the material of this course very interesting, and found it very challenging

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It is a good course for students who are interested in microeconomics.
Yes. For people who want to quickly has an idea of micro theory.
I would if they are interested in micro theory.
Yes. I think the concepts in game theory that we learned were interesting, and the problem solving skills involved are valuable.
